definition: to follow your orders/roger!/yessir!
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
classifier for a ream of paper
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Isn't the view beautiful? It takes my breath away .
sentences.chinese: 看这景色多美，美得令我窒息。

sentences.english: You may rest assured that all the orders will be executed to your entire satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 请放心所有订单会执行得令你方贸易。

sentences.english: The cold of the northern mountains chills me to my old and weary bones.
sentences.chinese: 北方山脉寒冷得令我的老胳膊老腿直打颤。

sentences.english: Every detail was worked out to everyone's satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 所有的细节都定得令大家满意。

definition: to obey orders
to accept an order
to shout an order or command
to promise/to agree to do sth
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
to obey an order/to comply/to do sb's bidding/to do as requested
(military) to leave one's place in the ranks/to fall out/(fig.) to emerge/to become prominent
to transmit an order
to issue an order
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to shout
all speaking together/in chorus
(military) messenger/orderly
to shout at/to berate
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
